entry.title: Entry #125 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court is Plaintiffs' Unopposed Motion to Withdraw Caroline P. Boisvert as Counsel. ECF No. 124 . The Motion is GRANTED. Accordingly, it is hereby ORDERED that Caroline P. Boisvert is withdrawn as counsel for Plaintiffs X Corp. and X.AI LLC in this matter. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 1/12/2026) (hcc) (Entered: 01/12/2026)

entry.summary: Unopposed MOTION to Withdraw as Attorney Caroline P. Boisvert filed by X Corp, X.AI LLC (Attachments: # 1 Proposed Order) (Eisman, Scott) (Entered: 01/09/2026)

entry.title: Entry #123 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: the Court SETS the 117 motion for a Hearing, on January 21, 2026, at 1:30 p.m. C.S.T., in the Fourth Floor Courtroom, Eldon B. Mahon United States Court House, 501 W. 10th Street, Fort Worth, Texas 76102.Prior to the hearing, lead counsel for the parties shall confer by telephone to discuss narrowing the issues for the Court to consider. Counsel SHALL file a joint status report on or before January 16, 2026 at 12:00 p.m. describing the results of their telephone conference and advising the Court of issues remaining for determination. Additionally, by January 16, 2026 at 12:00 p.m., Defendants SHALL file a response to the motion. (Ordered by Magistrate Judge Hal R. Ray, Jr on 1/8/2026) (wxc) Modified document relationship on 1/9/2026 (bdb). (Entered: 01/08/2026)

entry.title: Entry #122 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER: Before the Court is the 117 Motion to Compel Discovery from The Open AI Defendants and for Expedited Briefing. The Court hereby ORDERS that the Motion be referred to Judge Ray for further proceedings. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 1/8/2026) (mmw) (Entered: 01/08/2026)

entry.title: Entry #121 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: LETTER OF REQUEST FOR INTERNATIONAL JUDICIALASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE HAGUE CONVENTION ONTHE TAKING OF EVIDENCE ABROAD IN CIVIL OR COMMERCIALMATTERS TO OBTAIN EVIDENCE FROM LG ELECTRONICS, INC. (includes the certified Korean translation of the Letter of Request) (Clerk Note: see order for specific details) (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 1/6/2026) (mmw) Modified on 1/7/2026 (bdb). (Entered: 01/07/2026)

entry.title: Entry #120 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER GRANTING 115 MOTION FOR ISSUANCE OF LETTER OF REQUEST FOR INTERNATIONAL JUDICIAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE HAGUE CONVENTION ON THE TAKING OF EVIDENCE ABROAD IN CIVIL OR COMMERCIAL MATTERS: The Motion is hereby GRANTED and the Court APPROVES the proposed Letter of Request included with the Motion. Accordingly, the Court will execute the Letter of Request and the certified Korean translation of the Letter of Request with original signatures, to which the Clerk of Court shall affix original seals. Thereafter, the Court will directly transmit the Letter of Request and the certified Korean translation of the Letter of Request to the National Court Administration of the Republic of Korea. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 1/6/2026) (mmw) (Entered: 01/07/2026)

entry.summary: LETTER OF REQUEST FOR INTERNATIONAL JUDICIAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE HAGUE CONVENTION ON THE TAKING OF EVIDENCE ABROAD IN CIVIL OR COMMERCIAL MATTERS TO OBTAIN EVIDENCE FROM GOJEK SINGAPORE (Clerk Note: See order for specifics details.) entry.title: Entry #112 in X Corp. v. Apple Inc., 4:25-cv-00914
entry.summary: ORDER GRANTING UNOPPOSED MOTION FOR ISSUANCE OF LETTER OF REQUEST FOR INTERNATIONAL JUDICIAL ASSISTANCE PURSUANT TO THE HAGUE CONVENTION ON THE TAKING OF EVIDENCE ABROAD IN CIVIL OR COMMERCIAL MATTERS: Upon consideration of Plaintiffs' Unopposed 110 Motion for Issuance of Letter of Request for International Judicial Assistance Pursuant to the Hague Convention on the Taking of Evidence Abroad in Civil or Commercial Matters, the Motion is hereby GRANTED and the Court APPROVES the proposed Letter of Request included with the Motion. Accordingly, the Court will execute the Letter of Request with an original signature, to which the Clerk of Court shall affix an original seal. Thereafter, the Court will directly transmit the Letter of Request to the Ministry of Law of Singapore. (Ordered by Judge Mark Pittman on 12/29/2025) (saw) (Entered: 12/29/2025)
